navigationCompose = "2.9.5" ksp = "2.0.21-1.0.27" room = "2.8.3" spotless = "6.19.0" [libraries] androidx-core-ktx = { group = "androidx.core", name = "core-ktx", version.ref = "coreKtx" } androidx-datastore-preferences = { module = "androidx.datastore:datastore-preferences", version.ref = "datastorePreferencesCore" } androidx-datastore-preferences-core = { module = "androidx.datastore:datastore-preferences-core", version.ref = "datastorePreferencesCore" } androidx-navigation-compose = { module = "androidx.navigation:navigation-compose", version.ref = androidx-espresso-core = { group = "androidx.test.espresso", name = "espresso-core", version.ref = "espressoCore" } androidx-lifecycle-runtime-ktx = { group = "androidx.lifecycle", name = androidx-compose-bom = { group = "androidx.compose", name = "compose-bom", version.ref = "composeBom" } androidx-ui = { group = "androidx.compose.ui", name = "ui" } androidx-ui-graphics = { group = "ui-tooling-preview" } androidx-ui-test-manifest = { group = "androidx.compose.ui", name = "ui-test-manifest" } androidx-ui-test-junit4 = { group = "androidx.compose.ui", name = "ui-test-junit4" } androidx-material3 = { group = "androidx.compose.material3", name = "material3" } # ktor ktor-client-core = { group = "io.ktor", name = "ktor-client-core", version.ref = "ktor" } ktor-client-android = { group = "io.ktor", name = "ktor-client-android", version.ref = "ktor" } ktor-client-logging = { group = "io.ktor", name = "ktor-client-logging", version.ref = "ktor" } ktor-client-content-negotiation = { group = "io.ktor", name = "ktor-client-content-negotiation", version.ref = "ktor" } ktor-serialization-kotlinx-json = { group = "io.ktor", name = "README.md", "instructions": "I will add a comprehensive libraries documentation section after the screenshots table.", "code_edit": "### IntelliSoft Mobile Engineer Test\n\n## Screenshots\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Sign Up ScreenLogin ScreenPatient Listing Screen
Patient RegistrationVitalsGeneral Assessment
\n\n## Libraries Used\n\n### UI Framework\n- **Jetpack Compose** (`compose-bom: 2024.09.00`)\n - Modern Android UI toolkit for building native UIs\n - Includes Material 3 design system for consistent theming\n - Provides UI components, graphics, and tooling support\n\n### Navigation\n- **Navigation Compose** (`navigation-compose: 2.9.5`)\n - Type-safe navigation between composable destinations\n - Handles back stack management and arguments passing\n\n### Networking\n- **Ktor Client** (`ktor: 2.3.2`)\n - Multiplatform HTTP client for API communications\n - `ktor-client-android`: Android-specific engine\n - `ktor-client-content-negotiation`: JSON serialization support\n - `ktor-client-logging`: Network request/response logging\n - `ktor-serialization-kotlinx-json`: JSON content negotiation\n\n### Serialization\n- **Kotlinx Serialization** (`kotlinx-serialization-json: 1.7.1`)\n - Kotlin-native JSON serialization library\n - Type-safe serialization/deserialization of data classes\n\n### Dependency Injection\n- **Koin** (`koin: 4.1.1`)\n - Lightweight dependency injection framework\n - `koin-android`: Android-specific extensions\n - `koin-androidx-compose`: Compose integration for ViewModels\n\n### Data Persistence\n- **DataStore Preferences** (`datastore-preferences: 1.1.7`)\n - Modern SharedPreferences replacement\n - Type-safe key-value storage for app settings and user preferences\n\n- **Room Database** (`room: 2.8.3`)\n - SQLite abstraction layer for local data storage\n - `room-runtime`: Core Room library\n - `room-compiler`: Annotation processor for database generation\n\n### Core Libraries\n- **AndroidX Core KTX** (`core-ktx: 1.17.0`)\n - Kotlin extensions for Android APIs\n- **Lifecycle Runtime KTX** (`lifecycle-runtime-ktx: 2.9.4`)\n - Lifecycle-aware components and coroutines support\n\n### Testing\n- **JUnit** (`junit: 4.13.2`) - Unit testing framework\n- **AndroidX Test** (`junit: 1.3.0`) - Android instrumentation tests \n- **Espresso** (`espresso-core: 3.7.0`) - UI testing framework\n\n### Development Tools\n- **Spotless** (`spotless: 6.19.0`) - Code formatting and linting\n- **KSP** (`ksp: 2.0.21-1.0.27`) - Kotlin Symbol Processing for annotation processing\n\n## How to Run\n1. Clone the repository\n2. Open in Android Studio\n3. Sync Gradle dependencies\n4. Run the app on an Android device or emulator"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_018VTZJRzC3aKc3YrAPYZxQi","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file: ``` @@ -25,2 +25,75 @@ +## Libraries Used + +### UI Framework + +- **Jetpack Compose** (`compose-bom: 2024.09.00`) + - Modern Android UI toolkit for building native UIs + - Includes Material 3 design system for consistent theming + - Provides UI components, graphics, and tooling support + +### Navigation + +- **Navigation Compose** (`navigation-compose: 2.9.5`) + - Type-safe navigation between composable destinations + - Handles back stack management and arguments passing + +### Networking + +- **Ktor Client** (`ktor: 2.3.2`) + - Multiplatform HTTP client for API communications + - `ktor-client-android`: Android-specific engine + - `ktor-client-content-negotiation`: JSON serialization support + - `ktor-client-logging`: Network request/response logging + - `ktor-serialization-kotlinx-json`: JSON content negotiation + +### Serialization + +- **Kotlinx Serialization** (`kotlinx-serialization-json: 1.7.1`) + - Kotlin-native JSON serialization library + - Type-safe serialization/deserialization of data classes + +### Dependency Injection + +- **Koin** (`koin: 4.1.1`) + - Lightweight dependency injection framework + - `koin-android`: Android-specific extensions + - `koin-androidx-compose`: Compose integration for ViewModels + +### Data Persistence + +- **DataStore Preferences** (`datastore-preferences: 1.1.7`) + - Modern SharedPreferences replacement + - Type-safe key-value storage for app settings and user preferences + +- **Room Database** (`room: 2.8.3`) + - SQLite abstraction layer for local data storage + - `room-runtime`: Core Room library + - `room-compiler`: Annotation processor for database generation + +### Core Libraries + +- **AndroidX Core KTX** (`core-ktx: 1.17.0`) + - Kotlin extensions for Android APIs +- **Lifecycle Runtime KTX** (`lifecycle-runtime-ktx: 2.9.4`) + - Lifecycle-aware components and coroutines support + +### Testing + +- **JUnit** (`junit: 4.13.2`) - Unit testing framework +- **AndroidX Test** (`junit: 1.3.0`) - Android instrumentation tests +- **Espresso** (`espresso-core: 3.7.0`) - UI testing framework + +### Development Tools + +- **Spotless** (`spotless: 6.19.0`) - Code formatting and linting +- **KSP** (`ksp: 2.0.21-1.0.27`) - Kotlin Symbol Processing for annotation processing + +## How to Run + +1. Clone the repository +2. Open in Android Studio +3. Sync Gradle dependencies +4. Run the app on an Android device or emulator + ``` The edit was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I've added comprehensive documentation of all the libraries used in the project. The documentation is organized by category (UI Framework, Navigation, Networking, etc.) and includes: - Library name and version - Purpose and functionality - Specific modules used where applicable The documentation covers all major dependencies including Jetpack Compose, Ktor for networking, Koin for dependency injection, Room for database operations, DataStore for preferences, and various testing frameworks. I've also added a "How to Run" section for project setup instructions."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":" Going throught the folder structure of the app, draw the architecture in the Readme file "}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01UkEoXBrJkDeH17qLCfqrM3","type":"function","function":{"name":"list_dir","arguments":"{"relative_workspace_path": "app/src", "explanation": "Exploring the app source structure to understand the project architecture."}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"list_dir","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01UkEoXBrJkDeH17qLCfqrM3","content":"Contents of directory: [dir] app/src/androidTest/ - Nov 04, 2025 09:01 pm [file] app/src/main/java/com/samkt/intellisoft/utils/OneTimeEvents.kt (240B, 7 lines) - Nov 04, 2025 09:01 pm"},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01UMqaa4ANXfe5PoUZR6NQ4r","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"target_file": "README.md", "instructions": "I will add an architecture section with ASCII diagram showing the Clean Architecture layers and component relationships after the libraries section.", "code_edit": "### IntelliSoft Mobile Engineer Test\n\n## Screenshots\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Sign Up ScreenLogin ScreenPatient Listing Screen
Patient RegistrationVitalsGeneral Assessment
\n\n## Architecture\n\nThe application follows **Clean Architecture** principles with clear separation of concerns across three main layers:\n\n```\n┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐\n│ PRESENTATION LAYER │\n├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤\n│ features/ │\n│ ├── login/ - Login UI & ViewModel │\n│ ├── signUp/ - Registration UI & ViewModel │\n│ ├── home/ - Patient listing UI & ViewModel │\n│ ├── patientRegistration/ - Patient reg UI & ViewModel │\n│ ├── vitals/ - Vitals capture UI & ViewModel │\n│ ├── assessment/ - Assessment UI & ViewModel │\n│ └── navigation/ - Navigation graph & screen definitions │\n│ │\n│ core/ui/ │\n│ ├── components/ - Reusable UI components │\n│ └── theme/ - Material 3 theming │\n└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘\n │\n ▼\n┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐\n│ DOMAIN LAYER │\n├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤\n│ domain/ │\n│ ├── model/ - Business entities │\n│ │ ├── Patient.kt │\n│ │ ├── User.kt │\n│ │ ├── Vitals.kt │\n│ │ ├── Assessment.kt │\n│ │ └── Visit.kt │\n│ ├── repositories/ - Repository interfaces │\n│ │ ├── AuthRepository.kt │\n│ │ ├── PatientRepository.kt │\n│ │ └── UserRepository.kt │\n│ └── helpers/ - Business logic helpers │\n│ └── Result.kt │\n└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘\n │\n ▼\n┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐\n│ DATA LAYER │\n├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤\n│ data/ │\n│ ├── repositories/ - Repository implementations │\n│ │ ├── AuthRepositoryImpl.kt │\n│ │ ├── PatientRepositoryImpl.kt │\n│ │ └── UserRepositoryImpl.kt │\n│ └── mappers/ - Data transformation │\n│ └── Mappers.kt │\n│ │\n│ core/ │\n│ ├── database/ - Local storage (Room) │\n│ │ ├── IntellisoftDatabase.kt │\n│ │ ├── entities/ - Database entities │\n│ │ ├── daos/ - Data Access Objects │\n│ │ └── Converters.kt │\n│ ├── networking/ - Remote data (Ktor) │\n│ │ ├── IntellisoftApiService.kt │\n│ │ ├── IntellisoftApiServiceImpl.kt │\n│ │ ├── KtorClient.kt │\n│ │ ├── dtos/ - Data Transfer Objects │\n│ │ └── helpers/ - Network utilities │\n│ └── preferences/ - Settings storage (DataStore) │\n│ └── AppPreferences.kt │\n└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘\n```\n\n### Architecture Principles\n\n#### 1. **Dependency Inversion**\n- Higher-level modules don't depend on lower-level modules\n- Both depend on abstractions (interfaces)\n- Implemented using Koin dependency injection\n\n#### 2. **Single Responsibility**\n- Each class has one reason to change\n- Features are organized by functionality\n- Clear separation between UI, business logic, and data\n\n#### 3. **Testability**\n- Business logic isolated in domain layer\n- Dependencies injected through interfaces\n- ViewModels testable without Android framework\n\n#### 4. **Feature-Based Organization**\n```\nfeatures/[feature_name]/\n├── [Feature]Screen.kt - Composable UI\n├── [Feature]ViewModel.kt - Presentation logic\n└── di/[Feature]Module.kt - Feature dependencies\n```\n\n### Data Flow\n\n1. **UI Events** → ViewModel handles user interactions\n2. **ViewModel** → Calls repository methods (domain interfaces)\n3. **Repository** → Coordinates between local/remote data sources\n4. **Data Sources** → Database (Room) and API (Ktor) operations\n5. **Mappers** → Transform DTOs/Entities to Domain models\n6. **UI State** → ViewModel exposes state to Composable screens\n\n### Key Components\n\n- **MainActivity.kt** - Entry point with Compose setup\n- **IntellisoftApplication.kt** - Application class with Koin initialization\n- **MainGraph.kt** - Navigation setup and routing\n- **utils/** - Shared utilities (DateFormatter, OneTimeEvents)\n\n## Libraries Used\n\n### UI Framework\n- **Jetpack Compose** (`compose-bom: 2024.09.00`)\n - Modern Android UI toolkit for building native UIs\n - Includes Material 3 design system for consistent theming\n - Provides UI components, graphics, and tooling support\n\n### Navigation\n- **Navigation Compose** (`navigation-compose: 2.9.5`)\n - Type-safe navigation between composable destinations\n - Handles back stack management and arguments passing\n\n### Networking\n- **Ktor Client** (`ktor: 2.3.2`)\n - Multiplatform HTTP client for API communications\n - `ktor-client-android`: Android-specific engine\n - `ktor-client-content-negotiation`: JSON serialization support\n - `ktor-client-logging`: Network request/response logging\n - `ktor-serialization-kotlinx-json`: JSON content negotiation\n\n### Serialization\n- **Kotlinx Serialization** (`kotlinx-serialization-json: 1.7.1`)\n - Kotlin-native JSON serialization library\n - Type-safe serialization/deserialization of data classes\n\n### Dependency Injection\n- **Koin** (`koin: 4.1.1`)\n - Lightweight dependency injection framework\n - `koin-android`: Android-specific extensions\n - `koin-androidx-compose`: Compose integration for ViewModels\n\n### Data Persistence\n- **DataStore Preferences** (`datastore-preferences: 1.1.7`)\n - Modern SharedPreferences replacement\n - Type-safe key-value storage for app settings and user preferences\n\n- **Room Database** (`room: 2.8.3`)\n - SQLite abstraction layer for local data storage\n - `room-runtime`: Core Room library\n - `room-compiler`: Annotation processor for database generation\n\n### Core Libraries\n- **AndroidX Core KTX** (`core-ktx: 1.17.0`)\n - Kotlin extensions for Android APIs\n- **Lifecycle Runtime KTX** (`lifecycle-runtime-ktx: 2.9.4`)\n - Lifecycle-aware components and coroutines support\n\n### Testing\n- **JUnit** (`junit: 4.13.2`) - Unit testing framework\n- **AndroidX Test** (`junit: 1.3.0`) - Android instrumentation tests \n- **Espresso** (`espresso-core: 3.7.0`) - UI testing framework\n\n### Development Tools\n- **Spotless** (`spotless: 6.19.0`) - Code formatting and linting\n- **KSP** (`ksp: 2.0.21-1.0.27`) - Kotlin Symbol Processing for annotation processing\n\n## How to Run\n1. Clone the repository\n2. Open in Android Studio\n3. Sync Gradle dependencies\n4. Run the app on an Android device or emulator"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01UMqaa4ANXfe5PoUZR6NQ4r","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file: ``` @@ -66,6 +66,72 @@ - ``` The edit was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I've added a comprehensive architecture section to the README that includes: 1. **Visual Architecture Diagram** - ASCII art showing the three Clean Architecture layers (Presentation, Domain, Data) and their components 2. **Architecture Principles** - Key principles like Dependency Inversion, Single Responsibility, and Testability 3. **Feature Organization** - How features are structured with Screen, ViewModel, and DI modules 4. **Data Flow** - Step-by-step explanation of how data flows through the architecture layers 5. **Key Components** - Important entry points and utilities The diagram clearly shows: - **Presentation Layer**: Features organized by functionality, UI components, and theming - **Domain Layer**: Business models, repository interfaces, and business logic helpers - **Data Layer**: Repository implementations, local database (Room), remote API (Ktor), and preferences (DataStore) This gives developers a clear understanding of how the codebase is organized and how the different layers interact following Clean Architecture principles."}]}]}
